text: Track your expenses throughout the semester with a spreadsheet or budgeting app like this one!
Set aside a fixed percentage of every paycheck for emergencies.
Review your healthcare and insurance plans annually to ensure you're not overpaying or under-covered.
Prioritize necessities using a needs vs wants list.
Look into local community programs for financial support.
Avoid lifestyle inflation, do not spend more as your income rises
Ensure that your investments and your savings rise as your income does
Start building credit early with a credit card and pay off the full balance monthly on time.
Meal planning can save hundreds per month, shop with a list and limit takeout to special occasions if possible.
Tackle debt using the snowball or avalanche method â€” choose the one that keeps you motivated to stick with it.
Open a dedicated business account to simplify taxes and budgeting.
Keep your personal and business finances separate
Diversify your portfolio to manage risk
